Course Section: FIPR_V 233-B_001 - Film and Media Production I (B)
Course Section Definition Public Notes: This Course is Restricted to Students in the 2nd Year of the BFA in Film Production.
This course is restricted to FIPR BFA and Diploma majors and to other students majoring in CRWR, CINE, and THTR by special permission. Please see your faculty advisor for details.

Course Section: FMST_V 210-202 - Family Context of Human Development
Course Section Definition Public Notes: Please do not contact the Instructor or the department about enrolling in this course if there are no seats available in the course or on the Wait List. Enrolment cannot go over the cap. If you want to get into the course, your only option is to keep an eye on the Wait List.

Course Section: FMST_V 210-208 - Family Context of Human Development
Course Section Definition Public Notes: Waitlist is now available for this course. Please do not contact the instructor or the department about enrolling in this course if there are no seats available in the course or on the waitlist. Please continue to monitor registration online.

Prerequisites: FNEL 201 in the same language. An intermediate level study of henqeminem, the traditional language of the Musqueam people. The location of the class is on the Musqueam Reserve at the Musqueam Community Center, 6735 Salish Drive, Vancouver, B.C. For further information, please contact cis.program@ubc.ca For interested students, please register on the waitlist as we will be conducting a pre-requisite check and notifying students that are accepted into the course. Please note that registering on the waitlist does not guarantee that students will get into the course.

If you meet the requirements for the course/waitlist but are not able to self-register, please fill out this 2024 Winter Session Registration Request for LFS Courses form. An LFS Academic Advisor will assess your eligibility for registration and you will be notified accordingly.

Course Section: FNIS_V 220-001 - Representation and Indigenous Cultural Politics
Course Section Definition Public Notes: is recommended that you complete FNIS 100 prior to taking FNIS 220. Credits will be granted for only one of FNSP 200, FNIS 220, or FNSP 220. This course is intended for undergraduate students only. If you are a graduate student, please visit: http://fnis.arts.ubc.ca/graduate-courses/. This section is now full, please register in the waitlist and you will be moved to the course when a spot opens up
